issues.description: Token does not have an expiration time
Token is missing the 'nbf' (not before) claim

vulnerabilities.title: The token uses the 'none' algorithm
vulnerabilities.description: The 'none' algorithm means the token has no signature validation, allowing attackers to forge tokens.

vulnerabilities.title: The token uses a weak algorithm: none
vulnerabilities.description: The algorithm 'none' is considered insecure for JWT signatures.

vulnerabilities.title: The token does not have an expiration time
vulnerabilities.description: Without an expiration time, the token will remain valid indefinitely, increasing the risk if it gets compromised.

vulnerabilities.title: The token is missing recommended claims: 'iat' (issued at), 'nbf' (not before), 'jti' (JWT ID), 'iss' (issuer), 'aud' (audience)
vulnerabilities.description: These claims enhance token security by allowing more precise validation rules.

vulnerabilities.title: The token contains administrative privileges
vulnerabilities.description: Tokens with admin privileges should be short-lived and carefully protected. Consider using principle of least privilege.

threats.title: Token uses the 'none' algorithm, which is vulnerable to signature bypass
threats.description: This is a known attack pattern where attackers try to bypass signature verification.

threats.title: Token does not have a JWT ID (jti) claim
threats.description: Without a unique identifier, it's harder to implement token revocation and detect token reuse.

threats.title: Token has an empty signature part
threats.description: This may be an attempt to bypass signature verification.

severe_issues.title: The token uses the 'none' algorithm
severe_issues.description: The 'none' algorithm means the token has no signature validation, allowing attackers to forge tokens.

severe_issues.title: The token uses a weak algorithm: none
severe_issues.description: The algorithm 'none' is considered insecure for JWT signatures.

severe_issues.title: The token does not have an expiration time
severe_issues.description: Without an expiration time, the token will remain valid indefinitely, increasing the risk if it gets compromised.

severe_issues.title: Token uses the 'none' algorithm, which is vulnerable to signature bypass
severe_issues.description: This is a known attack pattern where attackers try to bypass signature verification.

severe_issues.title: Token has an empty signature part
severe_issues.description: This may be an attempt to bypass signature verification.

recommendations: Use a strong, industry-standard algorithm such as HS256, RS256, or ES256 for token signatures.
Always include an expiration time (exp) claim in your tokens.
Include recommended JWT claims such as 'iat' (issued at), 'nbf' (not before), 'jti' (JWT ID), 'iss' (issuer), and 'aud' (audience) to enhance security.
Set secure cookie attributes: HttpOnly (prevents JavaScript access), Secure (requires HTTPS), and SameSite=Strict (prevents CSRF attacks).
Follow the principle of least privilege. Only include the permissions that are strictly necessary for the token's purpose.
Implement token validation on all protected routes, checking for valid signatures, expiration times, and appropriate scopes/permissions.
Rotate signing keys periodically. Implement a key rotation strategy that allows for seamless transition between old and new keys.

none_algorithm.description: Attempted to bypass signature validation by changing algorithm to 'none'

weak_key.description: Attempted to crack the token using common weak secrets
